title: Bug 7785SaveAs Forgets the file type
description: Bug 7785SaveAs Forgets the file type The icon has also changed from the parent javafile icon to a generic file icon.
OB: 1) Open an existing java file2) Modify it (I moved an existing class)3) Click the SaveAs icon, next to the Save IconA dialog will come up.4) Browse for a valid container location5) Type the filename, but ignore the extension, which isn't requested.6) Click Ok.Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location, butwith no file extension shown.
EB: The file is for all intents and purposes nowa generic file, as opening it will provethe file is opened as text.Expected Behaviour:The file should be saved with the same extension as the original unlessexplicitly changed.
SR: 1) Open an existing java file2) Modify it (I moved an existing class)3) Click the SaveAs icon, next to the Save IconA dialog will come up.4) Browse for a valid container location5) Type the filename, but ignore the extension, which isn't requested.6) Click Ok.Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location, butwith no file extension shown.
